description: An abnormal increase in the level of triglycerides in the blood.

A heart conduction disease that is characterized by a transient or permanent absence of electrical and mechanical atrial activity and has_material_basis_in homozygous mutation in the NPPA gene on chromosome 1p36.
Reduced ability of the natural killer cell to function in the adaptive immune response.
Decreased concentration of adenosylcobalamin. Adenosylcobalamin is one of the active forms of vitamin B12.
Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against nut food products.
The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

Longstanding impairment in ventilation such that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is elevated above the upper limit of the reference range (more than 45 mm Hg), with a normal or near-normal pH secondary to renal compensation and an elevated serum bicarbonate levels (more than30 mEq/L).
Any molecular entity consisting of more than one atom.

Multiple cream-yellow colored hypopigmented choroidal anomalies whose size is approximately one quarter to one half of that of the optic disc, and whose location tends to cluster around the optic nerve radiating towards the periphery. The pattern of the lesions is said to be similar to gunshot spatter from birdshot.
This is an AE which is a long-term condition, usually kept stable by the treatment of symptoms.
A rectum cancer that derives_from epithelial cells of glandular origin.
Hypoplasia of the epiglottis.
A syndrome that is characterized by sensorineural hearing loss and ovarian failure.
A diminished activity of the classical complement pathway as measured by the assay for 50% haemolytic complement (CH50) activity of serum.
This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.
a wound AE that has an outcome of complication to the wound
An autosomal recessive nonsyndromic deafness that has_material_basis_in variation in the chromosome region 22q11.21-q12.1.

A neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis that is characterized by variable age of onset of symptoms (progressive dementia, seizures, and progressive visual failure) and lipopigment pattern of granular osmiophilic deposits, and has_material_basis_in homozygous or compound heterozygous mutation in the PPT1 gene on chromosome 1p34.
A combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency that has_material_basis_in homozygous or compound heterozygous mutation in GFM2 on chromosome 5q13.3.
A hereditary spastic paraplegia that has_material_basis_in mutation in the SLC33A1 gene on chromosome 3q25.31.
a sensorimotor painful neuropathy AE which has an outcome of distal sensory neuropathy characterized by damage to sensory and motor nerves
Discontinuity in the convexity of the inferior margin of the lobe.
Repeated infections of the urinary tract.

This is an AE which is a mental and behavioral disorder in which a person has intrusive thoughts (called obsessions) and/or feels the need to perform certain routines repeatedly (called compulsions) to an extent where it induces distress or impairs one's general functioning.
This is an AE which is a form of brief pain or headache commonly associated with consumption (particularly quick consumption) of cold beverages or foods such as ice cream, Popsicles, and snow cones.
This is an AE which is a disease in which there is permanent enlargement of parts of the airways of the lung and is infective exacerbation.
A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp.

A coronary artery vasospasm characterized by spasms of the coronary arteries that occur while at rest, generally late at night or early in the morning, resulting in severe chest pain with preserved exercise capacity.
A fasciculated bundle of neuron projections (GO:0043005), largely or completely lacking synapses.
This is an AE which is an umbrella name for impulse control behaviors involving compulsively damaging one's physical appearance or causing physical injury.
This is an AE which is a rare genetic disorder caused by pathogenic variants in the gene CDKL5.
Abnormality of galactoside metabolism. A galactoside is a glycoside (a suger moiety bound to some other moiety) containing galactose.
An Ehlers-Danlos syndrome that has_material_basis_in heterozygous mutation in the COL1A2 gene on chromosome 7q21.

A diffuse large B-cell lymphoma that is categorized as MCD with high probability by the LymphGen algorithm. This is based on a combination of genetic features and MCD DLBCLs often, but do not always, have the most common hot spot mutation in MYD88 (L265P) and/or activating mutations in CD79B. This subgroup also commonly has mutations due to aberrant somatic hypermutation affecting PIM1 and/or ETV6, which can be coding or non-coding.
A syndrome that involves abnormal development of the pancreas, nose and scalp, with mental retardation, hearing loss and growth failure. It is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner.
A rare congenital cystic lesion of the lungs in the mediastinum.
The name of the person, project, or organization that motivated inclusion of an ontology term by requesting its addition.
A Cornelia de Lange syndrome that has_material_basis_in a mutation in the SMC1A gene, which encodes a subunit of the cohesin complex, on chromosome Xp11.
A decreased or reduced level of the enzyme lactate dehydrogenase in serum.
Recurrent bouts of sudden, severe apnea that may be life-threatening.

text: cleft of alveolar ridge of maxilla
description: A gap (cleft) affecting one of the alveolar ridges, which are the protuberances in the mouth that contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth. An alveolar cleft can affect all structures of the alveolar ridge, including the gingiva, other mucosa, periosteum, alveolar bone, and teeth.
An elevated concentration of glucagon in the blood circulation.
A cranioectodermal dysplasia that has_material_basis_in homozygous or compound heterozygous mutation in the IFT122 gene on chromosome 3q21.
